CatDescriptText: Mr. George Ford, car washer, 637 Perry Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "The taverns close at midnight Saturday, but the 'houses' remain open. So therefore, I think that it's best to leave the taverns open.  The taverns are legal, the the 'houses' are illegal."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Ford, wearing light colored button down jacket, plaid button down collared shirt, and hat, standing next to man wearing light colored shirt and plaid cap, standing in front of chiseled stone building, arm leaning on top of public telephone, brick wall with sign inscribed "wors...th. committee...(Public Service Advertising Council)"
